alert.note: Alert for Eastern Hanover; Eastern Henrico; Western Hanover; Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond) (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 1:23PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Henrico and southeastern Hanover Counties and the City of Richmond through 200 PM EDT... At 122 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Glen Allen, or near Ashland, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lakeside around 135 PM EDT. Richmond around 140 PM EDT. Mechanicsville, Virginia Union University and Virginia Commonwealth University around 150 PM EDT. East Highland Park around 155 PM EDT. Highland Springs and Studley around 200 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Fair Oaks, Solomons Store, Chamberlayne, Atlee, Ashcake, Greendale, Hanover Airport, Dumbarton, Elmont and Montrose. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Hanover; Eastern Henrico; Western Hanover; Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond)
